roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses
Class Item

java.lang.Object
  roboRallyPackage.Terminatable
      roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Element
          roboRallyPackage.gameElementClasses.Item
Direct Known Subclasses:
Battery, RepairKit, SurpriseBox
public abstract class Item
extends Element

A class of items.

Version:
24 may 2012
Author:
Jonas Schouterden (r0260385) & Nele Rober (r0262954) Bachelor Ingenieurswetenschappen, KULeuven
Invariant:
The weight of this item, expressed in grams [g], must be a valid weight.
    this.canHaveAsWeight(this.getWeight())

Constructor Detail

Item

public Item(Position position,
            Board board,
            int weight)
Initializes this new item with the given position, board and weight [g].

Parameters:
position - The position for this new item.
board - The board on which this new item will be placed.
weight - The weight for this new item, expressed in grams [g].
Postcondition:
If the given weight is a valid weight for this Item, the weight of this item is set to the given weight.
    if(this.canHaveAsWeigh(weight)) then (new this).getWeight == weight
Effect:
This new item is initialized as an Element with the given position and the given board.
    super(position, board)

canHaveAsWeigh

public boolean canHaveAsWeigh(int weight)
Checks whether the given weight, expressed in grams [g], is a valid weight for this item.

Parameters:
weight - The weight to be checked, expressed in grams [g].
Returns:
...
    result != (weight < 0)
Returns:
...

takeHit

public abstract void takeHit()
                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
When an element is hit (e.g. it is shot by a robot) some of its properties are altered. Which properties and to what extend, depends on the elements.

Specified by:
takeHit in class Element
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - [CAN] When this item is terminated.
    this.isTerminated()
